verses.roman:
tataḥ sudāmno bhavanaṁ
mālā-kārasya jagmatuḥ
tau dṛṣṭvā sa samutthāya
nanāma śirasā bhuvi

synonyms: tataḥ—then; sudāmnaḥ—of Sudāmā; bhavanam—to the home; mālā-kārasya—of the garland-maker; jagmatuḥ—the two of Them went; tau—Them; dṛṣṭvā—seeing; saḥ—he; samutthāya—standing up; nanāma—bowed down; śirasā—with his head; bhuvi—on the ground.
translation: The two Lords then went to the house of the garland-maker Sudāmā. When Sudāmā saw Them he at once stood up and then bowed down, placing his head on the ground.
